common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Failure: Stuck on Core Dependencies
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS Desktop application failing to boot up, getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies" step. This occurs across macOS and Windows, potentially due to database migration issues or conflicts with OneDrive. Solutions include updating to the latest version, removing conflicting databases, and waiting for a patch to address the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Here is a summary of the Github issue conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

- Issues with the PiecesOS app on MacOS and Windows.
- App gets stuck on certain steps during the boot-up process.
- System tray icon and pieces OS components are not working properly.
- App launch leads to a web page suggesting restart, which doesn't resolve the issue.
- Problem with OneDrive interfering with the app on Windows.

**Problems Identified:**

- **MacOS:** 
    - App gets stuck at the first step of the boot-up process.
- **Windows:** 
    - PiecesOS components not showing up in system tray.
    - App may be stuck at "ensure core dependencies" step.
    - Conflict with OneDrive on Windows.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- **MacOS:**
    - Closing and reopening app may resolve the stuck issue.
    - A patch is planned to prevent the app from hanging altogether.
- **Windows:**
    - Update to version 11.1.1.
    - Remove conflicting database directory from OneDrive.
    - A patch will be shipped to prevent database migration issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- MacOS: 
    - Most files successfully moved back.
    - User will update later.
- Windows: 
    - A number of users confirmed the issue is resolved with the 11.1.1 update.
    - Users with conflicting OneDrive databases need to manually remove them.
    - Patch is being prepared for the database migration issue.

**Open Questions:**
- Whether the Windows user is still experiencing issues after the update needs further investigation.

**Additional Information:**
- The app link in the app doesn't work correctly with Firefox on Windows.

## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Title:** Slow boot time for PiecesOS (Desktop application)

**Author:** C2mokete (Date: Feb 14, 2025)

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up on the user's computer.
* User is unable to work due to the slow boot time. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Underlying cause of the slow boot time is not clear.
* User is unable to make it past the "ensure core dependency" stage in the Desktop application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support bot recommends checking related issues and resources.
* mark-at-pieces suggests trying the newly released version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed by mark-at-pieces on Feb 17, 2025.
* It is unclear if the user's issue was resolved with the new version of PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is encouraged to reopen the issue if the problem persists.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failures after update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after updating, particularly to version 11.1.1. This issue primarily affected macOS and was linked to stricter hardware requirements, specifically CPUs lacking AVX2 support. The Pieces team addressed the problem by releasing a patch in version 11.1.2, resolving the issue for most users.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Summary: **Key Points:** * The issue has been resolved. **Problems Identified:** * No specific problems are mentioned. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * No solutions are proposed or mentioned. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been closed, indicating it is resolved. **Additional Notes:** * The provided conversation is very short and lacks details. As a result, the summary cannot provide extensive insights.

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** 
* Users experiencing issues with PiecesOS version 11.1.1 related to hardware requirements being stricter than expected.
* Symptoms include the app not launching or malfunctioning.

**Key Points:**
* The issue was identified by users and automatically triaged by Pieces support bot.
* The support team requested logs from users for troubleshooting.
* The issue was related to #625.
* A fix was planned for release within 48 hours.

**Solutions:**
* Users were advised to provide support logs.
* A patch was released as version 11.1.2 on February 13th.

**Outcome:**
* Users were encouraged to update to 11.1.2 and report any remaining issues.
* The issue was closed by Pieces support on February 17th.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* `gonzososa` reported an issue: PiecesOS on macOS won't launch.
* This issue was similar to existing ones with piecesOS not launching.

**Problems Identified:**

* New vector library had AVX2 issues on various systems.
* Older CPUs lacked AVX2 support, preventing PiecesOS from running.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces worked on a fix, anticipating a release the next day.
* Users were asked for CPU information (Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz in this case).
* A fix was released as version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Users confirmed the issue was resolved with version 11.1.2.

**Additional Notes:**

* Pieces team was actively working on a solution and provided updates throughout the issue.
* This conversation demonstrates efficient troubleshooting and communication with users.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to database error
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Ubuntu and Windows reported PiecesOS failing to launch after version 11.1.1, encountering a 'DatabaseException' related to 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension and AVX2 CPU support. The issue stemmed from stricter hardware requirements. Pieces team released a patch in version 11.1.2 within days, resolving the issue for most users. Providing system logs aided in diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (GetReal444) experiencing issues booting up the Pieces application.
* Error message related to `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension and AVX2 not supported on the processor.
* Additional users reporting similar issues (possible broader impact).

**Problems Identified:**

* Hardware limitation due to AVX2 requirement for the database service.
* Issue affecting multiple users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team investigating and working on a solution.
* Estimated patch release within 24-48 hours.
* User requested to provide machine tech specs for further diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch released in version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS.
* User confirmed the issue is resolved after updating to the latest version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was related to a failing dependency of the AVX2 vector library on certain platforms.
* Pieces team was actively working on the issue and provided a prompt resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to cloud services and local LLMs, as well as launching the PiecesOS desktop application.  Suggested solutions include checking internet connection, switching networks, clearing browser cache, and examining firewall settings.  Support engineers are requesting log files for further diagnosis and debugging.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary (2025-02-16)

**Key Points:**

* User @rohanrathi99 experiencing issues with PiecesOS:
    * Cloud service requests not going through
    * Local models causing problems
* @rohanrathi99 provided log files for @mark-at-pieces to inspect.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewalls or network configurations blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Local model issues contributing to the problem.

**Solutions Proposed:**

* @mark-at-pieces requested com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd logs from @rohanrathi99.
* @mark-at-pieces proposed a real-time debugging session by scheduling a call on Google Calendar.

**Current Status:**

* @mark-at-pieces is reviewing the logs and requested a debugging session for further analysis.

**Next Steps:**

* Await @mark-at-pieces' feedback from log analysis.
* Schedule and attend the debugging session as proposed by @mark-at-pieces. 

**Additional Notes:**

* @mark-at-pieces has access to the shared Google Drive log files.

## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Title:** Slow boot time for PiecesOS (Desktop application)

**Author:** C2mokete (Date: Feb 14, 2025)

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up on the user's computer.
* User is unable to work due to the slow boot time. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Underlying cause of the slow boot time is not clear.
* User is unable to make it past the "ensure core dependency" stage in the Desktop application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support bot recommends checking related issues and resources.
* mark-at-pieces suggests trying the newly released version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed by mark-at-pieces on Feb 17, 2025.
* It is unclear if the user's issue was resolved with the new version of PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is encouraged to reopen the issue if the problem persists.

recommendations: **Prioritize addressing PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after updates (versions 11.1.1 and 11.1.2). Focus on identifying the root causes of these launch issues and implementing permanent fixes.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Several launch failures stem from stricter hardware requirements, especially AVX2 CPU support. Clearly communicate these requirements on the download page, installation instructions, and release notes to prevent user frustration.

**Develop more robust update mechanisms:** Issues arising from updates suggest potential improvements in the update process. Implement rigorous testing for new versions across different operating systems and hardware configurations before release.

**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Provide users with more informative error messages that pinpoint the cause of the issue and suggest potential solutions. Improve logging mechanisms to help support engineers quickly diagnose and debug problems.

**Create a comprehensive troubleshooting guide:** Develop a detailed troubleshooting guide addressing common issues like launch failures, connectivity problems, and database errors. This guide should be easily accessible within the application and on the Pieces website.

**Consider a dedicated support forum:** A dedicated support forum can provide a centralized platform for users to seek help, share solutions, and discuss issues. This can foster a sense of community and reduce the load on the support team.

**Proactively monitor system health and performance:** Implement monitoring tools to track system health, performance, and user feedback. This allows for early detection of potential issues and proactive communication with users about ongoing problems or planned maintenance.
